Title: Konqueror: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Konqueror, the worst of
    which may allow execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: Konqueror is the KDE web browser and file manager.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Konqueror. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted web site using Konqueror, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Konqueror users should upgrade to the latest version:

NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are
      available since November 11, 2012. It is likely that your system is
      already no longer affected by this issue.
